pairs.question: json litedb stream
pairs.answer: JSON to LiteDB Streaming - Stream large JSON datasets into LiteDB using inline C# sources. Demonstrates reading JSON files, parsing with System.Text.Json, and inserting BsonDocuments into LiteDB collections efficiently. Supports querying the populated database via .NET.

pairs.question: tree recursion
pairs.answer: Tree Recursion - Compile tree-recursive predicates (like tree_sum) that operate on hierarchical data structures. UnifyWeaver transforms recursive logic handling list-represented trees (e.g., [Val, Left, Right]) into executable bash scripts.

pairs.question: xml fragments c#
pairs.answer: C# XML Fragments - Stream and process XML fragments using C# XmlStreamReader. Supports NUL or LF delimited fragments, preserving CDATA, and handling namespaces (including Pearltrees prefixes). Projects elements and attributes into dictionaries.

pairs.question: powershell inline c#
pairs.answer: PowerShell Inline .NET - Embed C# code within PowerShell scripts using Add-Type for high performance (138x speedup with caching). Ideal for automation requiring .NET libraries or tight loops. Supports pre-compilation to cache DLLs and avoid compilation overhead on subsequent runs.
